Reviews.Title: Exactly right
Reviews.Author: brwalker
Reviews.Content: This camera was exactly what I was looking for. I have a bigger Fuji camera that I have been very happy with, but wanted a "pocket" camera that I could have with me all the time. This is perfect. I can take it to the restaurant when I have dinner with friends, or to little league practice, and it doesn't take up too much space, or too much of my time worrying about it. It takes great photos, and I am completely satisfied, and will purchase Fuji products again.This is a great point & shoot, take it and go camera

Reviews.Title: Does what I need it to do
Reviews.Author: Fzumrk
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my circa 2003 Fuji A310.  I got this to use for documenting project sites for my job.  I used it for one project so far and it did a decent job.  I've been taking pictures in 3 megapixel mode, as this is really all the resolution I need.  The photos look good for the most part.  Only a few blurry shots out of about 100 total.Pros:I prefer the AA batteries over a rechargeable battery.  I'm often out in the middle of nowhere taking photos for work.  So, if I run out of batteries, I can always stop in any convenience store and get more AAs.The battery life is excellent compared to my old A310.  The A310 would shut down when the batteries were only half used up.  I put the 'spent' batteries from the A310 in the AX300 and got over 100 flash photos out of them.I like the automatic switching from automatic mode to macro mode.  I do a lot of alternating between wide shots and macro shots, and the automatic switching is easier than switching manually.Cons:I may just need to shut one of the settings off, but on a few shots the face recognition software kicked in when there were no faces in the shot.  This messed the photo up.The camera has locked up on me once.  Opening and closing the battery compartment re-set it, but this will be annoying if it happens frequently.  The range finder also seemed to stop working once, but worked again after re-setting.Update:  I haven't had any issues with the camera locking up since the initial use.  I have also bought a second camera of the same model (one for home, one for work) and have had no issues with it.Doesn't include any memory, so make sure you purchase a SD card for it.  They used to at least give you a minimum sized memory card when you bought a new camera, but not anymore I guess.It doesn't have a viewfinder, which is handy on days with very bright sunlight.When you connect this to a computer via the USB cable it doesn't show up as a disk drive.  You have to use the camera wizard to get the photos off of it.  This may be a software issue and I'll see if I can find a work around.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures for such a small camera
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I recently bought a Fuji AX300 digital camera here. The camera has a 5X optical zoom which is decent for a small camera. This is my 2nd one of these small Fuji cameras and overall, it's a pretty decent digital camera when it comes to a basic point & shoot type.It's easy to use once you figure it out, has a decent 5X optical zoom, macro zoom that works pretty good and fairly good picture quality. Videos on this camera is not as good as the voices gets "choppy" and garbled, even at lower volume levels. So, I would not use this for a video uses, unless you're outside at a sporting event where sound is not too critical, then it's fine for that. Video quality is good however.Picture quality is fine in sunny weather, tho the pictures can get all sun-washed and in darker low-light weather, the pictures are poor quality. If you take indoor pics with the flash, the pictures will turn out okay. Outdoor pics under partly cloudy conditions produces good photos with this camera. There are some manual settings on this camera also.Not too much I hate about this camera, except for the garbled voices I periodically get on the video mode, but that's no biggie for me. It uses 2 AA batteries and battery life with this camera is not as good as other cameras I have had, but luckily it uses easy to find AA batteries.So to sum it up in a few words....yes, I would recommend the Fuji Finepix AX-300 digital camera for general photography, scenic photography and family indoor or outdoor photos.

Reviews.Title: Decent price for a decent point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: sky58
Reviews.Content: This is a decently priced point-and-shoot camera that takes good pictures with decent lighting (where you can get above 1/60th shutter speed on auto).  The 14MP is a bit of an overkill for most users, but it is certainly nice to have that resolution.  As others have stated, it does feel a bit "cheap" because of the plastic casing, but functionality-wise, it works well.  The only con about the about the camera so far is it doesn't perform too well in low lighting situations compared to other cameras for both photos and video.  Images come out a bit more muddy than other cameras in low light which is a bit noticeable when you compare it side by side with a picture from another camera.  The image stabilizer doesn't really add much to those photos either so don't expect anything amazing with that functionality. The 720p video is decent and good for use if you want to take a last minute video of something.  If you're going to be recording video for an extended amount of time, be sure to grab a larger SD card as with a 4 GB card you can get around 10 minutes of video.  The interface is about 95% digital menus so expect to refer to the manual for specific functions, but it's not difficult to navigate for simple shoot modes.Overall, I found this camera OK.  It won't knock your socks off or anything (that's why I only gave it 4 stars), but it certainly works well and will get the job done.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Lady zenomi "zenomi"
Reviews.Content: at first i was worried at how light camera felt out of the box almost like toy as another reviewer mentioned. However the pictures that this camera takes is great, straight forward, I am particularly happy with the fact that it has an option to take black and white pictures which I personally like for those vintage type shots i like to take. My only disappointment is that the camera does not contain a rechargeable battery other than that I am contented with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix AX300 14 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: alaskabaybe
Reviews.Content: The camera is nice looking, takes beautiful pictures, and is small enough to carry with you and not be cumbersome. Unfortunately, a very short time after I received the camera at the end of October, it stopped functioning correctly. The lens cover would not retract correctly, nor would it open entirely. I returned the camera to Fujufilm for repair, and nearly a month has passed and no word from Fujifilm on when I can expect my camera to be shipped back to me. Very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Frances "CRF"
Reviews.Content: Camera works well. Excellent pics & easy to handle.The only downside is that Fuji went cheap on the owners manual.A few pages in English that you need a magnifying glass to read! What a joke!My old A303 had a nice manual that gave you all the info on the camera.Although you can download a PDF on the AX300, much better to have a small manual to refer back to.All in all, a good camera so far.My A303 died & it was always eating batteries, guess it had an ulcer.Hope this helps someone out there.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: Chandra D Poliquin
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera.  For a simple point and shoot it takes very excellent pictures.  It has a lot of options to get the best quality pictures.  I was really looking for something to give me good action shots since I have two active little boys and it proved worthy!  Very happy with my purchase.  And as always Amazon has the best pricing and shipping.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: I. Gustavson
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because we had forgotten our digital camera when we returned to Florida from the North. I purchased the fuji camera because it was inexpensive but I was really surprised by the number of features, storage capacity. It works great.  In fact, I like it better than my expensive camera that I forgot up North since it is compact and takes better pictures.  The only downside I have with the camera system is trying to back up my download of pictures from the camera to my computer using the Finepix Studio program.  Once downloaded, I cannot seem to transfer pictures to a CD or flash stick.  It may be me so I am communicating with Fuji about my problem and there may be a simple answer.

Reviews.Title: Simply junk
Reviews.Author: I. Aboud "Troparion"
Reviews.Content: So I wanted to get a light camera for travel and convenience, and I thought I'd try this little one. It was tempting because of its features (photo and video in one) and it conveniently uses AA batteries. Right out of the box, the camera felt very light and cheap, a plastic toy. Its pictures were mediocre under normal lighting situations, but under low-light conditions they were terrible, and when I used the flash, the images came out fuzzy and way too bright. The video was not that great either; the worst thing about it was the clicking sound that came out during playback whenever the lighting level changed. I tested the video by slowly moving 180 degrees from bright daylight (through a window) to less and less light, until I was pointing into the dim room; on playback the video contained a loud click at almost every 30 degrees of movement. I've had two Fuji cameras in the past, the S1000fd is still my favorite. My experience with this one was a real disappointment. I returned it the next day.

Reviews.Title: Not durable
Reviews.Author: Songhai
Reviews.Content: Like many other folks who gave it 1 star, mine stopped working after several months.The lens would not retract. What makes it annoying is that I was one of those who bought it through HSN for $400.00 when it was released. There was so much hype about the camera because then it was the first point and shoot camera that had more than 10 megapixels. The closest camera to it has just 10 MP.The camera has very nice features and took beautiful pictures but durability is the problem.Since this is a common problem with the camera I wished Fuji had recalled all the faulty cameras and replaced it for the original owners. Prior to then I had another Fuji camera which impressed me so I went ahead to buy this one. I gave that older camera to my wife who used if for a few years before it started falling apart.No more Fuji camera for us!

Reviews.Title: Lens won't come out
Reviews.Author: Deimos "."
Reviews.Content: Nice pics but mechanically garbage. Lens won't come out just makes grinding noise.  Apparently it's a common problem with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Another fine Fuji camera
Reviews.Author: KSArnold
Reviews.Content: These little Fuji ax series cameras do a fine job.  That is why I got the ax300.  It works great like the other models and has the motion panorama feature.  This model is an old one but if you can get a good price the newer models are pretty much the same.

Reviews.Title: These refurbished Fujifilm Finepix AX cameras are just supper good
Reviews.Author: smedley
Reviews.Content: We use these in our Boot Hill Hikers Cemetery Ogling business. We photograph headstones, arrangements, etc. These little cameras work super good for our use. I never buy a new one, always a refurbished one for about 1/4 the cost. At $35 bucks or so, how can you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera
Reviews.Author: Collier M. Miller
Reviews.Content: Had another one just like it which we used so much that it took a beating but still works.  Just purchased another one since they have been discontinued and we have it when the old one dies.Seller sent out promptly.  Happy with transaction.

Reviews.Title: Another Outstanding Fuji Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Taylor
Reviews.Content: This is my second Fuji FinePix, I purchased one about 5 or 6 years ago. The first and now the 2nd (AX300) outperformed a $400 Canon digital my roommate has. He no longer uses his Canon. Anyway, photos are crisp and clear and that's what you want. It's easy to hold and operate. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: gutzy
Reviews.Content: Has worked well so far. Good instant camera. It is a depicted in the photo and is easy to use right out of the box.Have purchased fuji before and so decided to go with this.Not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera for cheap
Reviews.Author: SR "Sir"
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks. Got it "used-like new" from Amazon warehouse. Yup, no physical defects except that i noticed a stuck pixel in the upper right area of screen which I am thinking that's why someone returned it. It doesn't get in the way at all and disappears in certain shots. You have to look for it to see it. this camera rocks when it comes to taking pics in dark rooms. When I am getting ready to take a picture in low light, I point, give the camera about 1 second to focus, brighten image and do some other stuff and take the picture. pics come out flawlessly. Some one else stated that you should disable the auto features cause it delays and makes the pictures look bad, but for us who are not camera buffs, I recommend you you leave them on cause the camera is pretty smart and takes excellent pictures for me. When recording 720 HD video, it looks very good. When you zoom while recording in HD, the audio doesn't get clipped and you CAN'T hear the zoom mechanism in the video like other cameras. The only gripe I have with this camera is that when you  want to switch from video to photo mode or vise versa, you need to do it via the menu. That's beat for me but the photo and video quality makes up for it. The camera feels hollow and toy like cause this thing is very light which I think is a plus. I have not dropped it yet and hope it doesn't break. I have a fuji camera that has been dropped several times, even on the middle of the road while running, and it is still working after acting a bit glitchy for several minutes but operates at full capacity now. I like that this thing takes 2 AA batteries and don't have to worry about recharging it like other slim cams. You have an unlimited amount of ammo ;) I gave it 5 stars regardless of the photo to video navigation cause this thing gives you extra bang for your buck. BTW, remember to pick up a Class 10 SDHC card so that you don't have to worry about performance. I bought an AmazonBasics 16GB class 10 card for 12 bucks and some change and it works great.

Reviews.Title: good buy good product
Reviews.Author: lello
Reviews.Content: this product and 'very beautiful and practical, was what I wanted, I would recommend it to everyone, aesthetically excellent.creates beautiful pictures and videos, I'm glad I bought.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with it
Reviews.Author: S. Becker
Reviews.Content: * Takes decent-looking pictures* Worst thing: video recording doesn't even work right: in most videos, after about the first minutes, the sounds gets choppy, then it repeats part of the audio and ends up about 10 to 15 seconds behind the video! I'm surprised Fujifilm released the camera into production before fixing the issue.* Unintuitive to use, hard to not press the wrong button. For example, to play a video, you don't press the play button, instead you press down on the directional control.* Hard to switch between taking pictures and taking videos. If you want to video something quick, it's usually past by the time you go into the menus to select video mode and then back out of the menus.* Wish it didn't use regular AA batteries* (Wish we realized how bad it was before our 30 day return period ran out.)We were far happier with our Casio Exilim (before we dropped it one too many times on the cement). Wish we would have ordered a new one online; would have been worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Elesha Jc Gentry "Elesha"
Reviews.Content: This is great camera!  My husband loves it because it fits in his pocket and takes excellent pictures!  I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: amazon purchase of fiji film finpix AX300 14MP camera
Reviews.Author: wendy hutton
Reviews.Content: This camera is very convenient for snap shots as it can be carried easily in my purse.  It's menu is not entirely intuitive. I have taken some really great pics with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Worst piece of junk I ever bought!
Reviews.Author: joliveira
Reviews.Content: This camera was a complete disaster. I took it to a trip to France. When I bought I did not realize I had to use regular batteries. It was just before my trip so I did not have time to buy a more potent battery. In summary I spent a fortune in batteries. It is slow, when you try to get a good shot it doesn't work, I try to put the photos in the computer, surprise...it did not work, my husband had to put in his computer, it did not work on mine and another computer in the house. I feel like I threw money in the garbage.

Reviews.Title: Never worked.
Reviews.Author: melissa mclemore
Reviews.Content: Had to send it off for repair. When it returned it worked for 1 day. I will never purchase a Fugi camera again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and results.
Reviews.Author: ann c. maclean
Reviews.Content: Second purchase, a reliable and good quality lens....recommend without reservation. Excellent price for this camera. Good video for the price.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable mechanics
Reviews.Author: Calvin
Reviews.Content: I purchases this as a Christmas present for my daughter.  She took it on vacation for spring break and it stopped working after a couple of days (lens will not retract).  No major abuse to the camera, either.  I had a similar problem with a high-end Fuji camera as well but got the lens to work again with a little adjusting.  No such luck with this model, it's locked tight. :/

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix AX300 Power Supply Section Problem
Reviews.Author: Andy Peters "Andy"
Reviews.Content: I had a problem with my Fujifilm FinePix AX300 Camera when I received it.  Simply, the power supply section was draining the two AA batteries that came with the camera and the batteries no longer worked.  The original batteries that came with the camera were drained after using the camera for 2 hours of the first day.  I thought that was caused from the fact probably the batteries that came with the camera were older batteries that sat in the box for an extended period of time.  I bought and replaced them with a new fresh pack of batteries.  But, the same thing happened, the batteries no longer worked after a few hours of use.  I immediately called Fujifilm and explained my problem and they told me that the power supply section was draining the batteries.  They were very understanding and told me just to return the camera to Fujifilm and they would repair the camera.  If I had done that and Fujifilm repaired the camera and returned it to me, I felt I would of been buying a used camera at full price.  Since I bought the camera through Amazon and called and explained the problem, Amazon simply told me just to return the camera and they would credit my account.  Amazon emailed me a Return Label free of postage.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Monica Correa
Reviews.Content: Excelent quality of pics and videos, it's slim and very easy to use. You only need a huge internal memory and voila!

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE!!!
Reviews.Author: A Review
Reviews.Content: I really hate it. You would be better off shooting pictures with you phone. It's very inconvenient. I really would not recomend to any body. (Unless you wanted JUNK!!!)

ProductInfo.Features:
14-megapixel CCD sensor; 5x wide-angle optical zoom lens
720p HD movie capture
Advanced image search function for easy browsing
Smile/Blink Detection; i-Flash Intelligent Flash
Powered by AA batteries; capture images and video to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
14 million effective pixels; 1/2.3 inch CCD sensor; 5x optical zoom lens plus approx. 6.7x digital zoom
2.7 inch color TFT LCD monitor; HD movie 720p with sound
6 scene SR AUTO recognition; Motion Panorama mode with auto stitch
Digital image stabilization; Face and Blink Detection; Smile and Shoot mode; Auto red-eye removal
USB 2.0 High-speed; Video output NTSC / PAL selectable; SD/SDHC memory card slot (card NOT included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix AX300 14 MP Digital Camera with Fujinon 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom Lens (Black)
